titleStmt.title: A true report of all the doynges at the assembly co[n]cernyng matters of religion, lately holden at Poyssy in Fraunce. Written in Latine by Mayster Nicholas Gallasius, minister of the Frenche Churche in London, and then present, [and] one of the disputers in the same, translated into English, by I. D.... Seen and allowed accordyng to the order appoynted by the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions
True report of all the doynges at the assembly concernyng matters of religion, lately holden at Poyssy in Fraunce.
titleStmt.author: Des Gallars, Nicolas, ca. 1520-ca. 1580.

titleStmt.title: A true report of all the doynges at the assembly co[n]cernyng matters of religion, lately holden at Poyssy in Fraunce. Written in Latine by Mayster Nicholas Gallasius, minister of the Frenche Churche in London, and then present, [and] one of the disputers in the same, translated into English, by I. D.... Seen and allowed accordyng to the order appoynted by the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions
True report of all the doynges at the assembly concernyng matters of religion, lately holden at Poyssy in Fraunce.
titleStmt.author: Des Gallars, Nicolas, ca. 1520-ca. 1580.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Paules Churchyarde, by Luke Harryson],

notesStmt.note: Includes a translation of the proclamation of safe conduct for those attending the assembly dated 25 June 1561 (greek cross 6-greek cross8).
Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC.
Running title reads: The doinges at Poyssye in Fraunce.
Imperfect; much of translator's last name cut out of title page.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
